text: This depends a lot on what your API does. If it's returning a feed of public information - then it could be a reasonable scenario to open up the API by adding in lax CORS headers.

If it's interacting, or returning any information based on the context of the session/reading cookies/writing data, then you should avoid doing this. To be clear though - CORS is only one part of protections, and doesn't protect you fully from CSFR.
I was trying opening up search to a subdomain hosted on a non hs site
